oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Postcard depicting King George V of England
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This color printed British postcard was published by the Daily Mail and is titled, "The King At The Front: A talk to Peasants/Official Photograph-Crown Copyright res. 'Daily Mail' War Pictures." The king depicted is King George V of the House of Windsor. His royal lineage was actually of German origins and was the House of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha. Anti-German sentiments during WWI prompted him to change the title to Windsor. Kaiser Wilhelm II of Germany and Tsar Nicholas II of Russia were his first cousins.
